case.name: Phosphate Resources Ltd v Minister for the Environment Heritage and the Arts (No 3) [2008] FCA 1899 (12 December 2008)

held: unsuccessful appellant ordered to pay a percentage of each respondent's costs.

whether entitled to costs of the action
award of costs in discretion of court
summary of principles upon which discretion exercised

justices act 1928 (n.t.), s. 77(1). the appellant was charged with driving whilst being a disqualified driver. the charge was heard in the court of summary jurisdiction. the crown tendered a certificate which showed that a person by the appellant's name had been disqualified but did not establish that the appellant was the person therein referred to. the magistrate did not allow the crown to re-open its case so as to call evidence on the point, and dismissed the charge. the magistrate did not award costs to the appellant. the appellant appealed unsuccessfully to the supreme court and thence to the full court of the federal court. the appeal was directed only to the question of the failure to award costs to the successful defendant (appellant).
